alert.note: Alert for Southwest Highlands (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 22 at 7:50PM MDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Owyhee County through 830 PM MDT... At 750 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Albert Spring, or 39 miles northwest of Owyhee, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Albert Spring around 800 PM MDT. Frying Pan Spring around 810 PM MDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
